Authors:
Deanna A. Sutton, Josep Cano, Nathan P Wiederhold, Josep
Guarro, Alberto Miguel Stchigel
Title:
Two new species of Spiromastigoides (Spiromastixales,
Ascomycota)
Abstract:
Two new species of the genus Spiromastigoides
(Spiromastixales, Ascomycota) are proposed and described based on
morphological data and the analysis of rDNA sequences. They are
Spiromastigoides albida, from a lung biopsy in USA, characterized by
white colonies and a malbranchea-like asexual morph with curved
conidiophores; and Spiromastigoides sugiyamae, from soil in Japan,
morphologically very close to Spiromastigoides warcupii but with longer
peridial appendages and a thallic asexual morph. In addition, the new
combination Spiromastigoides alatospora (Gymnoascus alatosporus) is
proposed.
